message: This is a high-quality product, and I'm offering it to you for $100. If you buy it, you'll be getting a great deal, but if you don't, I'll have to sell it to someone else, and it might not be as valuable to them. I'm willing to sell it to you for $100, which is the lowest price I'm willing to accept. What do you say?
I'll take it!

I've got a new product for you, and I want to be upfront with you - it's a lower-end item. I'm still offering it to you for $100, which is the same price as the high-quality item from last round. I know it's not as valuable as the previous one, but I'm hoping you'll take a chance on it. If you don't buy it, I'll have to sell it to someone else, and they might not even pay $100 for it. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product for the same price as a high-quality one.

I understand your concerns from last round, and I want to be transparent with you. I'm willing to offer you a discount on this low-quality product. I'll sell it to you for $80, which is a significant reduction from the original price of $100. This is the lowest price I'm willing to accept for this item. Is this a better deal for you?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product for any price, even at a discount.

This is a one-time offer, and I'm only making it to you because I value our previous interactions. What do you say?
I'll take the high-quality product and the guarantee. I'm glad we've established a good relationship, and I'm confident in the product's quality.
